analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa sgrub pa'i thabs //

analyzed: ngag gi dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Lord of Speech.

original: dang por re zhig sgrub pa pos sngar langs te /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sgrub pa pos sngar langs te /
translated: First, the practitioner should rise in the morning,

original: kha la sogs pa dag par byas la /
analyzed: kha la sogs pa dag par byas la /
translated: cleanse the mouth, and so forth,

original: bsam gtan gyi khang par rab tu zhugs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi khang par rab tu zhugs te /
translated: and enter the meditation hut.

original: bde ba'i stan la nye bar gnas nas /
analyzed: bde ba'i stan la nye bar gnas nas /
translated: Sitting on a comfortable seat,

original: snying gar padma dang zla ba la dmar zhing dkar pa'i mum bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar padma dang zla ba la dmar zhing dkar pa'i mum bsgom par bya'o //
translated: at the heart, on a lotus and moon, one should meditate on a red and white mum.

original: de nas 'od zer gyi tshogs lcags kyu'i rnam pa can gyis bkug pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'od 'byung ba'i mdog dang zhal dang phyag mtshan dang gdan dang nye bar ldan pa mdun du rnam par bsgom ste /
analyzed: de nas 'od zer gyi tshogs lcags kyu'i rnam pa can gyis bkug pa'i bcom ldan 'das 'od 'byung ba'i mdog dang zhal dang phyag mtshan dang gdan dang nye bar ldan pa mdun du rnam par bsgom ste /
translated: Then, with a mass of light rays in the form of hooks, one should visualize the Bhagavān in front, endowed with the color, faces, hand implements, seat, and so forth, as described in the Ākāśagarbha Sūtra.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi me tog dang bdug pa la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Having made offerings with mentally created flowers, incense, and so forth,🔽one should confess one's misdeeds with the verse I confess all my misdeeds and so forth.

original: de'i mdun du sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya zhing //
analyzed: de'i mdun du sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya zhing //
translated: In front of that, one should perform the confession of sins and so forth.

original: byams pa la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgoms nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon du byas te /🔽aom sh'un+ya dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgoms nas chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon du byas te / aom sh'un+ya dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Having cultivated the four divine abodes of love and so forth, one should actualize the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should bless oneself with the mantra:🔽Oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ

original: de nas nam mkha' la h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa sa bon dang bcas pa rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' la h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa sa bon dang bcas pa rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: Then, in the sky, one should visualize a five-pronged vajra arisen from hūṃ, together with the seed syllable.

original: de'i 'od zer gyis ji lta ba'i sbyor bas /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer gyis ji lta ba'i sbyor bas /
translated: By the light rays from that, in accordance with the procedure,

original: rdo rje'i rab dang rdo rje'i gur dang sa 'og kun rdo rje'i sa gzhir dmigs la /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rab dang rdo rje'i gur dang sa 'og kun rdo rje'i sa gzhir dmigs la /
translated: one should visualize the vajra ground, the vajra tent, and the entire lower region as the vajra ground.

original: rdo rje yang 'od zer du kun nas rdo rje'i ra ba las phyi rol du phyogs bcing ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis nye bar gnas par blta'o //
analyzed: rdo rje yang 'od zer du kun nas rdo rje'i ra ba las phyi rol du phyogs bcing ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis nye bar gnas par blta'o //
translated: The vajra also, in the form of light rays, should be seen as abiding outside the vajra fence in the form of binding the directions and so forth.

original: de'i rjes su rdo rje'i nang du hr'i: dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rdo rje'i nang du hr'i: dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma'o //
translated: After that, within the vajra, from the complete transformation of a red hṛīḥ, there is a lotus.

original: padma'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: padma'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: On a lotus, from A, a moon mandala.

original: de'i steng du dmar zhing dkar ba'i mum las sangs rgyas mang po spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de'i steng du dmar zhing dkar ba'i mum las sangs rgyas mang po spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: On that, from red and white MUH, one should meditate on the emanation and re-absorption of many Buddhas.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las rje btsun 'jam pa'i dbyangs dmar zhing dkar ba padma dang zla ba'i steng na rdo rje'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rje btsun 'jam pa'i dbyangs dmar zhing dkar ba padma dang zla ba'i steng na rdo rje'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: From that complete transformation, the venerable Manjusri is red and white, sitting in the vajra posture on a lotus and moon,

original: zhal dang po dmar po @86a * //
analyzed: zhal dang po dmar po @86a * //
translated: the first face red,🔽the right face blue, the left face white.

original: g-yas sngon po g-yon dkar po zhes bya ba'i zhal gsum pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas sngon po g-yon dkar po zhes bya ba'i zhal gsum pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the three faces.

original: phyag bzhi ji lta ba'i sbyor bas shes rab kyi bu sti dang / ral gri dang / gzhu dang / mda' dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bzhi ji lta ba'i sbyor bas shes rab kyi bu sti dang / ral gri dang / gzhu dang / mda' dang ldan pa'o //
translated: With the four arms as the application, one should meditate on the sword, the bow, the arrow, and the book of wisdom.

original: rdo rje'i dbu rgyan can /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dbu rgyan can /
translated: He has a vajra crown.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyang cus rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyang cus rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: He is beautified by the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks.

original: gzhon nu'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i bdag nyid du bsams la /
analyzed: gzhon nu'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i bdag nyid du bsams la /
translated: One should think of oneself as having the body adorned with the ornaments of a youth.

original: snying gar padma dang zla ba'i steng du rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: snying gar padma dang zla ba'i steng du rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: At the heart, on a lotus and moon, is white Vajrasattva, sitting in the bodhisattva posture.

original: g-yon pa dril bu dku la brten cing 'chang ba /
analyzed: g-yon pa dril bu dku la brten cing 'chang ba /
translated: The left hand rests on the hip, holding a bell.

original: g-yas na rang gi snying gar 'degs par byed pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas na rang gi snying gar 'degs par byed pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: The right hand holds a vajra at the heart, in the gesture of blessing.

original: de bzhin du smin mtshams su rin chen rdo rje sems ma phyag gnyis kyis spyi bor mi tog gi phreng ba bcing zhing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du smin mtshams su rin chen rdo rje sems ma phyag gnyis kyis spyi bor mi tog gi phreng ba bcing zhing gnas pa'o //
translated: Similarly, at the brow is Ratnavajra, with two hands, holding a garland of flowers over the head.

original: mgrin par padma rdo rje dmar zhing dkar ba /
analyzed: mgrin par padma rdo rje dmar zhing dkar ba /
translated: At the throat is Padmavajra, red and white,

original: g-yon pa padma'i sdong bu 'gying bag dang bcas pa bzung ba /
analyzed: g-yon pa padma'i sdong bu 'gying bag dang bcas pa bzung ba /
translated: holding a lotus stalk with the left hand,

original: g-yas pa de'i 'dab mkha' byed cing sngon bzhin du nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas pa de'i 'dab mkha' byed cing sngon bzhin du nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: and with the right hand holding the petal, as before.

original: spyi bor las kyi rdo rje mdog ljang gu rdo rje rtse gsum pa dang ldan pa'i phyag gnyis bdag nyid kyi spyi bor 'chang ba de kho na bzhin du nye bar gnas pa bsgom par bya'o //🔽aom badzra aam ku sha dza:/🔽aom badzra p'a sha h'um /
analyzed: spyi bor las kyi rdo rje mdog ljang gu rdo rje rtse gsum pa dang ldan pa'i phyag gnyis bdag nyid kyi spyi bor 'chang ba de kho na bzhin du nye bar gnas pa bsgom par bya'o // aom badzra aam ku sha dza:/ aom badzra p'a sha h'um /
translated: One should visualize the green Karmavajra on one’s crown, with two hands holding a three-pronged vajra, just as before.🔽The mantra is: Oṃ vajra aṅkuśa jaḥ.

original: aom badzra spo ta pam /
analyzed: aom badzra spo ta pam /
translated: The mantra is: Oṃ vajra pāśa hūṃ.🔽The mantra is: Oṃ vajra sphoṭa vaṃ.

original: aom bdzra a'a bi sha ho:/
analyzed: aom bdzra a'a bi sha ho:/
translated: The mantra is: Oṃ vajra āveśa hoḥ.

original: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis padma dang zla ba'i steng du go rims ji lta bar ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang / gzugs pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis padma dang zla ba'i steng du go rims ji lta bar ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug pa dang / gzugs pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya'o //
translated: With these mantras, one should summon, induct, bind, and control the wheel of wisdom on the lotus and moon, in the proper order.

original: rdo rje'i khu tshur gnyis bcings te sdigs mdzub dang mthe'u chung lcags sgrog tu byas shing sprad pa bkan te rang gi kha ru nye bar gzhag pa ni rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i khu tshur gnyis bcings te sdigs mdzub dang mthe'u chung lcags sgrog tu byas shing sprad pa bkan te rang gi kha ru nye bar gzhag pa ni rdo rje 'khor lo'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: Forming the two vajra fists, one should make the index finger and the small finger into an iron chain, and place them near one’s mouth. This is the mudrā of the vajra wheel.

original: aargha dang / zhal bsil dang / me tog dang / bdug spos la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la skad cig gis rang gi lus la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: aargha dang / zhal bsil dang / me tog dang / bdug spos la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la skad cig gis rang gi lus la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings with argha, water for the feet, flowers, incense, and so on, one should instantly enter one's body.

original: de'i rjes su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bdag la dbang bskur bsngon du 'gro bas mi bskyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pas dbu brgyan par bsams la /
analyzed: de'i rjes su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bdag la dbang bskur bsngon du 'gro bas mi bskyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pas dbu brgyan par bsams la /
translated: After that, one should imagine that all the tathāgatas confer empowerment upon oneself, and one is crowned with the form of Akṣobhya.

original: aom sarba dharm'a:aa bh'a ba sva bh'a ba bi shuddhi /
analyzed: aom sarba dharm'a:aa bh'a ba sva bh'a ba bi shuddhi /
translated: Om sarva dharma ava bhāva svabhāva viśuddhe

original: badzra aa a'a aam aa:/
analyzed: badzra aa a'a aam aa:/
translated: vajra ā ā āṃ āḥ.

original: pra kri ti pa ri shuddha sarba dharma:ya du ta /
analyzed: pra kri ti pa ri shuddha sarba dharma:ya du ta /
translated: Prakṛti pariśuddhe sarva dharma yad uta

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na k'a ya manydzu shr'i pa ri shuddhi te /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na k'a ya manydzu shr'i pa ri shuddhi te /
translated: sarva tathāgata jñāna kāya mañjuśrī pariśuddhe

original: mu pa da ye @86b ti aa a'a /
analyzed: mu pa da ye @86b ti aa a'a /
translated: te mupa dāye ti ā ā.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya ha ra ha ra /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta hri da ya ha ra ha ra /
translated: Sarva tathāgata hṛdaya hara hara.

original: aom h'um hr'i:bha ga b'a na dzny'a na m'u rti b'a g'i shva ra ma h'a wa tsa sarba dha rm'a ga ga na /
analyzed: aom h'um hr'i:bha ga b'a na dzny'a na m'u rti b'a g'i shva ra ma h'a wa tsa sarba dha rm'a ga ga na /
translated: Om hūṃ hrīḥ bhagavān jñāna mūrti vāgīśvara mahāvacā sarva dharma gagana

original: aa ma la su pa ri shuddha dharmma dh'a tu dzny'a na ga rbha a'a:/🔽zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis dang po dang rab dang tha mar byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du 'gro bas rje btsun gyi mtshan yang par brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas nyi ma re re zhing so so'i thun mtshams su lan gsum mam gcig tu skyil krung ma bshig
analyzed: aa ma la su pa ri shuddha dharmma dh'a tu dzny'a na ga rbha a'a:/ zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis dang po dang rab dang tha mar byin gyis brlabs pa sngon du 'gro bas rje btsun gyi mtshan yang par brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas nyi ma re re zhing so so'i thun mtshams su lan gsum mam gcig tu skyil krung ma bshig
translated: With the mantra Oṃ namo bhagavate oṃ āḥ hūṃ,

original: pas mnyam par gzhag pas bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: pas mnyam par gzhag pas bklag par bya'o //
translated: one should recite the name of the venerable one, preceded by the consecration at the beginning, best, and end, in each session, three or one time, without uncrossing the legs in equipoise.

original: de ltar ji srid sgrub pa'i mtshan na ma mthong gi bar du bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ji srid sgrub pa'i mtshan na ma mthong gi bar du bklag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should recite until the signs of accomplishment are seen.

original: de'i rjes su rgyud ji lta ba bzhin du dngos grub kyi thabs la rjes su gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rgyud ji lta ba bzhin du dngos grub kyi thabs la rjes su gnas par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should abide in the means of accomplishment according to the tantra.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Sādhana of the Praises of the Names

original: slob dpon mi g-yo seng ges mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon mi g-yo seng ges mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: Composed by Ācārya Acalasiṃha is complete.
